records.text: I, of course found this out after I'd spent days making textures for it, only to find that part of what I worked on is completely useless. The whole point of the texture was glow in the dark (emissive) effects. Basically the garment was textured in such a way that it would fade from a brilliant rainbow into a colorful starry sky as the light dimmed. This won't work in Blinn-phong. All the work I put into the emission layers is useless. I have like FIVE unique, custom painted textures that I spent hours on just to discover they're useless. It completely scraps future plans. Beyond frustrating.

records.text: Aaaaa I think this mesh is just broken in #secondlife and now I'm frustrated enough to actually just try rigging again. The problem is (mostly) a bad UV though. The best I can determine after about 12 hours of tinkering is that the UV overlaps. Which isn't really visible in Blinn-phong. PBR wants that missing uv piece, and upon finding it is blank, just gives up and falls back on Blinn Phong. The problem? The mesh also overlaps, unevenly. So I can't just treat it face by face, because the bits with the missing UV poke through in the back of the garment. Unfortunately it was a full perm promo item from a very famous SL store.  Complaining is like pissing in a hurricane for that sort of place. I kind of want my money back but I'm sure they'll say it was experimental blahblah. Additional problem: I still actually want it, and there's not anything else like it full perm right now. But the thing doesn't *work* right, and I don't think it's actually a fixable problem.

All the work I put into the emission layers is useless. I have like FIVE unique, custom painted textures that I spent hours on just to discover they're useless. It completely scraps future plans. Beyond frustrating.

records.text: Aaaaa I think this mesh is just broken in #secondlife and now I'm frustrated enough to actually just try rigging again. The problem is (mostly) a bad UV though. The best I can determine after about 12 hours of tinkering is that the UV overlaps. Which isn't really visible in Blinn-phong. PBR wants that missing uv piece, and upon finding it is blank, just gives up and falls back on Blinn Phong. The problem? The mesh also overlaps, unevenly. So I can't just treat it face by face, because the bits with the missing UV poke through in the back of the garment. Unfortunately it was a full perm promo item from a very famous SL store.  Complaining is like pissing in a hurricane for that sort of place. I kind of want my money back but I'm sure they'll say it was experimental blahblah. Additional problem: I still actually want it, and there's not anything else like it full perm right now. But the thing doesn't *work* right, and I don't think it's actually a fixable problem.

records.text: I, of course found this out after I'd spent days making textures for it, only to find that part of what I worked on is completely useless. The whole point of the texture was glow in the dark (emissive) effects. All the work I put into the emission layers is useless. I have like FIVE unique, custom painted textures that I spent hours on just to discover they're useless. It completely scraps future plans. Beyond frustrating.

records.text: Aaaaa I think this mesh is just broken in #secondlife and now I'm frustrated enough to actually just try rigging again. The problem is (mostly) a bad UV though. The best I can determine after about 12 hours of tinkering is that the UV overlaps. Which isn't really visible in Blinn-phong. PBR wants that missing uv piece, and upon finding it is blank, just gives up and falls back on Blinn Phong. The problem? The mesh also overlaps, unevenly. So I can't just treat it face by face, because the bits with the missing UV poke through in the back of the garment. Unfortunately it was a full perm promo item from a very famous SL store.  Complaining is like pissing in a hurricane for that sort of place. I kind of want my money back but I'm sure they'll say it was experimental blahblah. Additional problem: I still actually want it, and there's not anything else like it full perm right now. But the thing doesn't *work* right, and I don't think it's actually a fixable problem.
